greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primitive inequivalent sublattices of square lattice having mirrors parallel to the sides of the unit cell of the parent lattice of index n.
comment: _Andrey Zabolotskiy_'s new formula confirms that a(n) indeed is a function of A305891(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 01 2018
link: Andrey Zabolotskiy, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
John S. Rutherford, Sublattice enumeration. IV. Equivalence classes of plane sublattices by parent Patterson symmetry and colour lattice group type, Acta Cryst. (2009). A65, 156-163. [See Table 5.]
formula: Let b(n) = A007875(n) for n>1, b(1) = 0. Then
a(n) = b(n) + b(n/2) for even n.
Thus the sorted list of all terms (except for a(1)=0) is A029744. (End)
xref: Cf. A145393 (all sublattices of the square lattice), A019590, A157228, A157230, A157231, A304182, A007875, A029744.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 25 2009
ext: New name and more terms from _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, May 09 2018
